description:
I have a feeling or two that Clovery is stealing my information, but I need what Clovery is. It's just Mozilla Firefox in a nice shell that hides the internet and gives you the perfect enclosure for all your Google Services. It feels like it struggles at times but it gets you your stuff.

I would use an alternative, but until I have found one that isn't made by Google then I'm right here. It just needs some more authenticity. It feels like some guy wanted a few peoples Google passwords. But I'm also a Duckduckgo user, I'm not using anything by Google.
the snap store is not working i cant open the apps i downlode
summary: i really cant give a true rating

description: I were received message that I am currently running the free version of Clovery which does not include premium features such as adding unlimited number of services & accounts, blocking ads & trackers and more. To remove the limitations, please purchase Clovery Plus from our website.
I like this one, but it's being so much stuck sometimes and trackers are there on this. but, I like it. My browser was gone, So I could only use this.

This is the worst example of freemium app I ever witnessed. Out of 50+ web-apps available to be managed by the wrapper, only two could be accessed without coming up against the pay-wall. What's pitiful is that I expected more features to be exposed to the user, but I have been let down. VERY IMPORTANT FACT: I have been using Rofi and Qutebrowser to achieve the only useful feature in this app, quick switching between the Google services, for a little while now and to me this is more intuitive.
Only Gmail and Youtube were available without upgrade and purchasing the licence. Well for that I seriously dont need this app.

After installation the application will not respond to any mouse clicks or key presses. The system menu and min/max/close buttons do work but the app is pretty much unresponsive. As such, not very useful.
On startup, the app doesn't respond to any actions. The window is closeable and resizeable but doesn't respond. Do not install.
no sirve, esto es Linux y open sourse...
summary: lo mismo te cobran por poner más de 1 aplicación
